Class Library

  • java.lang.Object
    • Library

  •  class Library
extends java.lang.Object
    To complete the Library class you will need to: X - 1. Add the appropriate import statements. X - 2. Complete the declaration of the checkoutBooks HashMap. Use generics to specify the key and value types. In this case, the key is isbn number of book and value is an list of 1 or more patrons that have borrowed this book. X - 3. Implement the constructor to initialize the HashMap. X - 4. Implement the checkoutBook(String,String) method. This is an isbn for book and one patron thats checking it out X - 5. Define and implement the checkoutBook(String, String variable argument list) method declaration and implement the method. This is an isbn for a book and any number of patrons that are checking it out. X - 6. Define and Implement the returnBook(String,String) method. Is isbn for book and person return the book X - 7. Define and Implement the printCheckoutBooksByIsbn(String) method by isbn number only X - 8. Optional, Define and implement printAllCheckoutBooks() method

      private static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> checkoutBooks

    • Field Detail

      • checkoutBooks

        private static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> checkoutBooks
        All checked out Books are stored in this map. The HashMap has a String key for the isbn and the data is an ArrayList of Strings with patron's name

    • Constructor Detail

      • Library

        Library()
        Constructor, initializes the entries HashMap.

    • Method Detail

      • checkoutBook

        public void checkoutBook(java.lang.String isbn,
                java.lang.String... args)
        add isbn book checked out to patron - Iterates the arguments down to just one at a time. Checks the value of an ISBN and if its null it creates a new arraylist. Then adds the arg to the list. If ISBN is not null it adds the arg to the existing array
        Parameters:
        isbn - - this is the book number for the checked out book
        args - - this is the person or people that are checking out the book, stored in the arraylist.

      • printCheckoutBooksByIsbn

        public void printCheckoutBooksByIsbn(java.lang.String string)
        prints who has checked out a book based on the ISBN
        Parameters:
        string - - this string contains the book number - ISBN

      • returnBook

        public void returnBook(java.lang.String isbn,
              java.lang.String patron)
        This checks books back into the library based to the ISBN and the patrons name. Also, if all copies of the book have been returned, it removes the key from the hashmap and tells you all the outstanding copies of that book have been returned
        Parameters:
        isbn - - this is the book number of the book being returned
        patron - - this is the person returning the book

      • printAllCheckoutBooks

        public void printAllCheckoutBooks()
        this prints all the patrons names and all the books that have been checked out
